> > @kezhenxu94 We may consider how to showcase this. How about just opening the Zipkin tracer on Envoy in the mesh? Then we at least could have some spans.
> 
> We already open Envoy SkyWalking tracer in showcase, there is no way to open both Zipkin tracer and SkyWalking tracer at the same time

I can't find a trace including the envoy span. I think we don't, otherwise, the topology should be very strange.(the alias name could be strange unless we set the `not-analysis` attribute to true for the segments from envoy)
We just instrument the services, and sidecars forward the `sw8` headers.

Also, we even don't have a trace tab on the mesh dashboard.

The component ID in service and process topology are sharing the same mechanism from the kernel level now. 

After this is merged, I would consider removing the component ID from the instance topology. If you have any concerns, please let me know.
My idea is, we never show this, and as an `n pods(ServA) * m pods(ServB)` size topology, there is pointless to show the component of each node.
This would be only a logical level change, I will add a notice to the GraphQL file to declare these cases. And will keep those type/component fields as empty strings only.

I just noticed that envoy generates the zipkin format trace context by default when forwarding HTTP protocols. If we want to show that both envoy and skywalking traces are included, we can enhance the demo service to support both skywalking and zipkin traces.

Hello @hanahmily. I would like to work on this.
We don't create so many threads, what do you mean memory leak?

It's NOT memory leak. The thread leak is no created by the agent. It's triggered by the service which the agent is wathing.
The problem is when skywalking-java monitoring a service with many threads, one of the agent's threads' CPU usage is high.
As a contrast, Pinpoint's agent does not have the problem.

After tracing the agent's thread, we local time cost at ThreadProvider.getThreadMetrics().
This func takes 400ms to check all  4000  threads' status in our case, and this process goes every 1sec.
Can I pick this up?
Ready for review @wu-sheng @hanahmily
Is this problem solved?
@mohammedtabish0 Please go ahead.

>As a contrast, Pinpoint's agent does not have the problem.

There is no point to mention this. Please don't do this in further discussion.

> After tracing the agent's thread, we local time cost at ThreadProvider.getThreadMetrics().
This func takes 400ms to check all 4000 threads' status in our case, and this process goes every 1sec.

Yes, this is how it works. What do you want to ask?

> Yes, this is how it works. What do you want to ask?

Is this frequency necessary？I checked the oap,  the related metrics are aggregated by longAvg() in 1min.
I wonder if 2 or 3 collections in 1min is enough?

> There is no point to mention this. Please don't do this in further discussion

Got

> > Yes, this is how it works. What do you want to ask?
> 
> Is this frequency necessary？I checked the oap, the related metrics are aggregated by longAvg() in 1min. I wonder if 2 or 3 collections in 1min is enough?

You could contribute a feature to customize this period if you like.
I will, thank you!

> Is this problem solved?

RocketbotUI is now obsolete and replaced by BoosterUI [here](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-booster-ui), you will need to upgrade your skywalking deployment to version 9.x. @cylrk

No sure but you might need to regenerate the zipkin-license from the new Lens dependency's package.json and package-lock.json， if they have new dependencies or versions changes in Lens, this is needed.

> No sure but you might need to regenerate the zipkin-license from the new Lens dependency's package.json and package-lock.json， if they have new dependencies or versions changes in Lens, this is needed.

Could you provide which command I should run? I thought it is a part of CI check.
Do you mean I need to copy the lock file again from the Zipkin repo?

> Do you mean I need to copy the lock file again from the Zipkin repo?

You have to regenerate the zipkin-LICENSE from the package.json and package-lock.json in https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/2.24.0/zipkin-lens, this is no part of CI because they are using npm 14 and we are using npm 16. Also, even we copy their package.json and package-lock.json, we have to manually upgrade those 2 files every time we upgrade the zipkin-lens version. So I'd prefer just check in the generated ziplin-LICENSE file instead of check in the 2 large files
@kezhenxu94 Updated.
Could you explain more about how this override happens? They are two classes, why would one will override the other?

> Could you explain more about how this override happens? They are two classes, why would one will override the other?

For dispatcher classes, it uses the `scopeName + "Dispatcher"` as the class name and b/c both of `ServiceMeshServiceDispatcher` and `ServiceDispatcher` have the same scope (`service`), thus the generated class names are the same `ServiceDispatcher`
Be careful of full class name, it would be an issue for window(too long file path, sometimes show on git clone as well.)

As this file is generated sequentially, you could generate `_index` when the name is in conflict. 
In your case, maybe `ServiceDispatcher.class` and `ServiceDispatcher_1.class` are a better choice. After all, this is not a runtime name.

> As this file is generated sequentially, you could generate `_index` when the name is in conflict. In your case, maybe `ServiceDispatcher.class` and `ServiceDispatcher_1.class` are a better choice. After all, this is not a runtime name.

In my case, in the file content, the class name is `ServiceMeshServiceDispatcher`, but the file name is `ServiceDispatcher.class`. I have used `metricsClass.getSimpleName() `to replace the original argument `className` to fix the problem.
i had used filter to deal it. but i think it is so ugly. is there any better way to reslove it ?

Let's see @BFergerson has any suggestions.

@naah69 For a community, there is nothing urgent. All PMC members are volunteers here, they just contribute and answer questions for their own interests.

I reviewed the PromQL. I think besides the basic grammar, we could choose these four APIs as MVP 1. Metadata Query API, https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/2.37/querying/api/#querying-metadata. Metadata has a specific meaning for us. We could expose our metadata metric names(e.g. service_traffic). - listMetrics could be considered a kind of metadata if possible(TBD) 2. Metrics value Query API, https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/2.37/querying/api/#expression-queries. Metrics as time-series values could be queried and returned in the expected format. - When the `range` is missed, we could pick the latest 30 mins - We need to recognize and pick dimensions automatically, to avoid `too many data points` error and overload - There should be a complete label set to define our scope in order to get metrics correctly. I didn't read Grafana+PromQL Datasource carefully yet, but I hope we have a chance to provide topology, at least topology line metrics. 3. Alerts API, https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/2.37/querying/api/#alerts. This could directly query our alarms with some pre-defined labels(e.g. rule_name) 4. Build Info, https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/2.37/querying/api/#build-information. This is our version service. With all the implementation, we need to define our details, mostly about specific labels. Complete docs should be added under `APIs/Query APIs/PromQL` **Notice, we should explicitly declare at the top of the new PromQL API doc. The APIs are built on top of GraphQL APIs, and only provide a feature subset of GraphQL APIs**. @wankai123 Please add anything you found on your side.

Only when the UI query the start/end is null, will this cause any problems?

> > I think it should not be both null. @mrproliu Please could you confirm the use case?
> 
> Only when the UI query the start/end is null, will this cause any problems?

We are going to remove `TimeBucket` tag from database and we don't want to scan all time range. Is it possible to narrow down the scan time range?

We could provide a reasonable range?
The BanyanDB expects a time range for query, I believe we should not let DAO implementation to pick the default range.

> > > I think it should not be both null. @mrproliu Please could you confirm the use case?
> > 
> > 
> > Only when the UI query the start/end is null, will this cause any problems?
>

Do we need the start/end time bucket both not empty? or one of them？
@lujiajing1126 I think when the time range is missing, it is as same as `service_traffic` query. List all available tasks for UI, nothing special. Any tech block?

> @lujiajing1126 I think when the time range is missing, it is as same as `service_traffic` query. List all available tasks for UI, nothing special. Any tech block?

We could use `START_TIME` instead of `TIME_BUCKET`?
I think the key here is, this query wants all tasks, no filter.
CI pass. PTAL @wu-sheng
How is `IProfileTaskQueryDAO` going to be about?

> How is `IProfileTaskQueryDAO` going to be about?

`TIME_BUCKET` and `STAR_TIME` is equivalent in this case since the `start_time` is annotated with `@BanyanDB.TimestampColumn`. So it can be used interchangeably.

Explaining this is not community responsibility. We only encourage you read data through APIs.
We will introduce a new memory layer.
Since we will introduce a new unified memory layer, the opened blocks won't determine the memory usage of a shard.
The related configuration is https://etcd.io/docs/v3.2/op-guide/configuration/#--auth-token

> Make sure jar package is signed by jarsigner tools

We don't have experience of jarsigner. What is that?

jarsigner is a general tool provided by JDK for signing jar packages. we use this command to make jar package is signed.
```
jarsigner -keystore xxx.store sprringboot-app.jar xxx
```
here is official explanation: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/jarsigner.html
Are you using JDK7? It is not working for our agent.
As you are going to check the jar sign, have you signed the agents? In our release, we don't do this kind of sign. We just provide `asc`/`shasum512` signs for the tar ball only.

> Are you using JDK7? It is not working for our agent.

we use jdk1.8 
java version "1.8.0_111"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_111-b14)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.111-b14, mixed mode)

I am going to move this to the discussion, as this seems more like how to use an agent with `jarsigner`, rather than a bug.
And AFAIK, there is no one in the committer team having experience with this.
